page.title: 15THE NORTHERN BY-PASS
page.content: THE NORTHERN BY-PASS WAS COMPLETED IN 1984 AND IS 3.25 MILES LONG. IT FORMS THE FINAL PART OF AN IMPROVED HIGHWAY NETWORK LINKING EASTERN, NORTHERN AND WESTERN APPROACHES TO GLOUCESTER. THE SECTION BETWEEN ELMBRIDGE AND TEWKESBURY ROAD ROUNDABOUTS CONSISTS OF DUAL 7.3 M. CARRIAGEWAYS WITH 1 M. HARD SHOULDERS SEPARATED BY A 2.5 M. CENTRAL RESERVE. THE BY-PASS IS BUILT MAINLY ON EMBANKMENT WITH A SHALLOW CUTTING IN THE LONGFORD AREA. HALF A MILLION CUBIC METRES OF PRIMARILY LIAS CLAY WAS IMPORTED TO BUILD THE EMBANKMENTS. BRIDGES ARE PROVIDED TO CARRY THE BY-PASS OVER SANDHURST LANE AND TO CARRY LONGFORD AND INNSWORTH LANES OVER THE BY-PASS. A FOOTBRIDGE IS PROVIDED AT PAYGROVE.
